Did exactly what it claims to do. Allowed me to connect my Wii remote to my phone. Make sure bluetooth and location turned on. Wii remotes are stubborn. If pair but wiimote light still blinking, unpair and forget device. Dont enter any pairing code, cancel and try again. Sometimes helps to clear app data and reboot phone. Be persistant, it will work.

If you're wondering why this app requires the use of your location or are wondering why it doesn't work, it's because you can't read simple app descriptions and instructions. Wii U Pro controller support is experimental and didn't work for me no matter what I did likely because it's just experimental support. I look forward to that feature being fully implemented if it can be.

On Android Pie and newer, the WiiRemote pairing does no longer work because now for setConfirmPairing, a system permission is needed: BLUETOOTH_PRIVILEGED which a non-system app won't ever get. Contact me on github if you bother to attempt a fix.

A little on how I got it to work: Put batteries in Wiimote, press red pairing button. Hold 1+2 at same time. Android said Wiimote connected but wasn't paired. Go to Android Bluetooth settings, disconnect the remote. Leave app running in background. Turn off remote, back on. When the device is shown in the Bluetooth device list of Android (not app) but it's not connected, press it. When it asks for a password put 0000, then it should pair.

I thought for sure this was impossible since Android removed native wiimote support and nobody has made an app like this before, but sure enough this app works flawlessly, and with the right configuration can be used to play most games with controller support. I can finally play Wii games on my phone with a real wiimote! Of course the motion controls aren't detected by anything and as others have said, the + and - buttons don't work either, but this is barely an issue in gameplay.

This app works great and is by far the easiest to use. Took me less than 10 seconds to pair my WiiMote to my phone. Just had to configure the controls and now I'm playing my favorite GBA games. So much better than having to use the screen and now my phone doesnt start overheating after like an hour. Thank you so much!
